description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Moments in Hạ Long Bay" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Moments in Hạ Long Bay

places.generalDescription: Cat Ba National Park, located on the island of the same name, is a vast and diverse natural reserve. Encompassing lush forests, limestone peaks, mangroves, and marine waters, the park boasts an impressive array of flora and fauna with over 1,500 species. Visitors can spot rare animals such as the endangered white-headed langur and enjoy birdwatching with 160 bird species in the area.

sources.snippet: Covering almost half of the island of the same name, Cat Ba National Park has a variety of different landscapes and ecosystems for you to explore, each more beautiful than the last. As it encompasses everything from karst mountains and verdant forests to mangroves and marine waters, it is very biodiverse, with over 1,500 species of fauna and flora. In addition, there are also 160 bird species and 20 types of mammals for you to spot, with its golden-headed langur, one of the most endangered primates on Earth, being the highlight of the lot.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to do in Halong Bay, Vietnam

sources.snippet: Whether you’re interested in organizing a boat trip or savoring freshly caught seafood at local restaurants, Cat Ba Island provides convenient access to pier facilities, scooter rentals, and proximity to attractions like Cat Ba National Park.
sources.siteName: Bai Tho Junks Official Site - Halong Bay Boutique Cruises
sources.shortName: Ha Long Bay Travel Guide - A local insight [2024] - Bai Tho Junks

places.name: Cat Ba National Park

reviews.text: This was an incredible hike. Many steep wet trails as it's in the jungle. Take your time. There's beautiful trees but beware of their long roots. Plenty of places to take a break and rest within the jungle. The top view is worth every moment!

Definitely worth doing when on Cat Ba.  It is quite a difficult hike in terms of gradient. Most of the track is quite well formed steps, with only a couple of short areas where you negotiate some rocky bits.
Go early in the morning as it's a hot humid climb, and take 2l water per person.

We were at this national park the other day. It was a rainy day, hence walking and climbing was not easy as some areas were slippery. Nice view and a nice and peaceful place. The museum was also nice and informative.

places.generalDescription: Sung Sot Cave, also known as Surprise Cave, is one of the largest and most popular caves in Halong Bay. Visitors can explore its two chambers filled with impressive rock formations that resemble various objects and creatures. To reach the cave, tourists must climb 680 steps through lush greenery, but the breathtaking inner views make it worth the effort. The cave is illuminated with colored lighting and offers guided tours for an enhanced experience.

sources.snippet: One of the most popular and indeed famous attractions in Halong Bay, and rightfully so, Sung Sot Cave is a delight to visit due to all the majestic rock formations inside. Discovered all the way back in 1901 by the French, the cave is located on Bo Hon Island, and visitors have to clamber up a long flight of stairs before reaching the mouth of the cave. Here, you can either wait a moment to take in the marvelous views of Halong Bay or head into its cavernous interior.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to do in Halong Bay, Vietnam

sources.snippet: The caves and grottoes are among the most coveted Halong Bay attractions and to date, 59 caves have been discovered and listed in the official register. Located at Bon Hon Island,  Sung Sot Cave is quite special among them because it is one of the largest in Halong. To get there, you’ll need to hike up a steep trail, but it’s definitely worth the effort for the inner views.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

sources.snippet: Sung Sot Cave, also known as Surprise Cave, is one of the largest and most impressive caves in Halong Bay. Its name is fitting, as visitors are often astonished by the sheer size and intricate formations within. As you step inside, you'll be greeted by two main chambers filled with stalactites and stalagmites that create whimsical shapes and patterns.
sources.shortName: Exploring the 10 Most Beautiful Places in Halong Bay Vietnam, Halong Bay Travel Guide & News

sources.snippet: During a day cruise, you can explore renowned attractions in Halong Bay, such as Sung Sot Cave and Titop Island, or engage in activities like kayaking and bamboo boat rides in Luon Cave. Additionally, you have the opportunity to visit floating villages and partake in various activities, with lunch provided on board as part of the day cruise program.
sources.siteName: Bai Tho Junks Official Site - Halong Bay Boutique Cruises
sources.shortName: Ha Long Bay Travel Guide - A local insight [2024] - Bai Tho Junks

sources.snippet: Sung Sot Cave, also known as Surprise Cave, is the largest and most famous cave in Halong Bay. The cave’s grand chambers are filled with impressive stalactites and stalagmites, illuminated by colorful lights. The intricate rock formations provide fantastic opportunities for capturing detailed and atmospheric shots.
sources.shortName: Top Photography Spots in Halong Bay – Luxco Travels

sources.snippet: The system of caves in Halong Bay is a great place for visitors to explore and conquer caves. Sung Sot Cave is one of the three largest and most beautiful caves in Halong Bay. The cave is located on the island of Bo Hon in the heart of the world heritage.
sources.shortName: The Images Of Halong Bay Tourist Sites

sources.snippet: Sung Sot Cave should be on top must-visit destination when you are in Halong Bay. It is the largest and also the most renowned, the most visited cave of all. The cave is around 1000 square meters consisting of thousands of stalagmites and stalactites.
sources.shortName: 29 Best Things to Do in Halong Bay & City: Attractions (Photo)

sources.snippet: The plan to take epic photos in HaLong Bay would not be complete without a list of beautiful attractions such as Ti Top Island, limestone cave, Sung Sot cave, Trong Mai island. Those are really the castles of the Creator in the middle of the world.
sources.shortName: 7 tips to capture the beautiful scenery of HaLong Bay

sources.snippet: Sung Sot cave is another legendary experience, often called the most famous of the Halong Bay limestone caves. 100 stone steps mark the entrance to the various chambers, once again denoted by the kaleidoscopic light and geological wonders.
sources.shortName: Halong Bay: Best places to photograph

places.name: Sung Sot Cave

reviews.text: This is an incredible natural wonder, but be ready for large crowds - especially during peak hours. The cave features stunning stalactite and stalagmite formations, dramatic chambers, and well-lit pathways that make exploring easy. The tour is well-guided, and platforms allow you to safely enjoy the incredible rock formations. While the cave is beautiful and impressive, the number of visitors can make it feel rushed and less peaceful. If you go, try to visit early or later in the day for a slightly quieter experience. Still, it's a must-see highlight of Halong Bay!

We visited these caves as the last stop of our tour, and they were absolutely breathtaking. The rock formations were stunning, especially the final cave, which, according to our guide, is over 10,000 square meters in size. It was also noticeably cooler inside compared to the outside heat, making the visit even more enjoyable. Definitely worth it!

Sung Sot Cave is beautiful and definitely worth a visit for its stunning formations and spacious chambers. The hike to the cave is fairly easy and manageable for most people, but do expect a lot of stairs.

However, it was extremely crowded during our visit, which took away a bit from the overall experience. It can be hard to fully enjoy the serenity and scale of the cave when you're surrounded by large tour groups.

If possible, try to go early in the morning or during off-peak times to avoid the rush.

places.address: Ha Long Bay, Halong City, Quảng Ninh

places.generalDescription: Lan Ha Bay is a stunning destination with a secluded atmosphere, featuring boats, beaches, and small mountainous islands. It's becoming a popular choice for sailing excursions due to its pristine and less-crowded sightseeing routes compared to Halong Bay. The area offers picturesque landscapes and numerous caves to explore, such as Luon Cave, Sung Sot cave, Trong Cave, Tien Cave, and Trinh Nu Cave on Bo Hon Island.

sources.snippet: Located to the south of Halong Bay, Lan Ha spreads over an area of more than 7000 ha. The bay reserves the pristine scenery which has an intense concentration of limestone mountains. There are hundreds of beautiful, small beaches lying at the feet of mountains so there is no problem to find a good spot for an overnight camp or organizing a private beach BBQ.
sources.shortName: 29 Best Things to Do in Halong Bay & City: Attractions (Photo)

sources.snippet: Lan Ha Bay, located to the southwest of Halong Bay, is often considered an extension of the main bay and explored by many well-known Halong Bay Cruise lines. It's a less crowded and more tranquil alternative, known for its pristine beaches and emerald waters. The bay is dotted with small fishing villages, limestone formations, and hidden lagoons.
sources.shortName: Exploring the 10 Most Beautiful Places in Halong Bay Vietnam, Halong Bay Travel Guide & News

sources.snippet: Located to the East of Ha Long Bay, Lan Ha Bay is a laid-back alternative to the vibrant atmosphere of Ha Long Bay with a more soothing feeling. It is home to 400 limestone cliffs and numerous rocky mountains, making it suitable for rock climbing. Rock climbing at Lan Ha Bay allures a lot of enthusiastic adventurers, especially foreign visitors.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Ha Long Bay: 14 SUPER FUN activities

sources.snippet: Just like Bai Tu Long, Lan Ha Bay is a more serene and less touristy alternative to Halong Bay. Since it is a fair way from Halong City, not a lot of tourist boats venture here, which means Lan Ha Bay has a more secluded appeal. It has its own impressive collection of 300-or-so karst islands, along with a staggering 139 white-sand beaches.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

sources.snippet: Located in Cat Ba island, this point of view encompasses the entire view of Lan Ha Bay, a part of Halong Bay region. Beside the good view to observe from, there are plenty of activities like rock climbing or trekking.
sources.shortName: How to take the best photos in Halong Bay? Expert Advice for Photography in Halong Bay

places.name: Lan Ha Bay

reviews.text:
Lovely bay for kayaking and swimming.
Less touristy than Ha Long Bay and definitely not so crowded. Lovely sunset. Highly recommended to visit ☺️

We discovered Lan Ha Bay, a less crowded alternative to Ha Long Bay, offering a serene escape for couples. The majestic limestone karsts rising from emerald waters create a breathtaking backdrop. We enjoyed relaxing, swimming in secluded lagoons and exploring hidden caves. The area's colorful culture is evident in the floating villages, where we observed local life. With fewer tourists, Lan Ha Bay provides a more intimate experience of Vietnam's natural wonders. It's an ideal destination for those seeking tranquility and unspoiled beauty in a romantic setting. We paid the tour 650k from our Hotel: The Wave View Hotel. Tour starts 8.30am and finishes at 5pm. Lunch included, plus kayaking, swimming in caves, monkey islands, etc
It was great, I'd recommend it!

A wonderful place and a MUST visit if you are touring Vietnam. The Bay area is well organized but not much of a wonder… But if you take the cruise to go around towering islands and spend one night at least on water you will have a wonderful experience worthy for a lifetime. I really enjoyed it. We joined BlueDiamond Cruise. Their hospitality was great and the facilities and activities were very nice.
I'm really happy that I joined this trip. Will definitely go there with my family once again. I saw many families with small kids and disabled persons visiting the area taking cruise ships.

places.generalDescription: Dau Go Cave, also known as the Cave of Wonders, is a limestone cave in Halong Bay, Vietnam. It is the largest among many caves in the region and is located on Driftwood Island. The cave's name translates to 'Wooden Stakes' in Vietnamese due to its historical significance during the Mongol invasion of 1288.

sources.snippet: The largest of the many caves and grottoes that dot the region, Dau Go Cave’s three enormous chambers are dazzling to gaze upon; as such, it’s no surprise that it is also known as ‘the Cave of Wonders.’. Meaning ‘Wooden Stakes’ in Vietnamese, Dau Go is so named because a general hid wooden stakes in the cave during the Mongol invasion of 1288; these were later used to defeat the horde. Beautifully illuminated, its many stalagmites and stalactites protrude dramatically from the cave walls, and the fantastical formations look as if they have just been taken out of a child’s fairytale book.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to do in Halong Bay, Vietnam

sources.snippet: Dau Go Cave, also known as Wooden Stakes Cave, is another impressive cave in Halong Bay. The cave’s three main chambers are filled with dramatic stalactites and stalagmites, making it a great spot for capturing the bay’s geological wonders. The cave’s historical significance, being associated with the 13th-century battle against the Mongol invaders, adds an intriguing element to your photographs.
sources.shortName: Top Photography Spots in Halong Bay – Luxco Travels

sources.snippet: The cave is located on Dau Go Island and recorded to be the largest cave across the region. Dau Go cave has been existing for roughly 2 million years with a width of 12 meters, while the entrance gate is recorded to reach 17 meters in height.
sources.shortName: Best Photogenic Spots in Halong Bay

places.name: Dau Go Cave

reviews.text:
Amazing place with so many stories, of course made up stories.
The cave is beautiful, huge, and clean.
The tour guides explain the stories in detail.
There are many photo spots, these are utilised well because it's mostly moderately crowded.
There are some shops selling drinks, snacks and souvenirs, nothing pushy during my visit.
Amazing experience! We took a ferry boat here and had about 30 mins to explore the caves. Would definitely recommend it if visiting Ha Long Bay!

This cave is located in the Halong Bay area, you need to climb a fairly high staircase to get there. The view from the top of the cave is also very beautiful with a view of Halong Bay. The atmosphere inside the cave is quite dark, but at some points there are colorful lights shining on the cave rocks. There are quite a lot of tourists visiting, since there is no entrance ticket.

places.generalDescription: Cát Bà Island is the largest island in Ha Long Bay and is known for its diverse natural ecosystems, including marine and terrestrial habitats. The island is home to a national park that covers about half of its area, providing a sanctuary for the highly endangered Cat Ba langur. With limestone karsts, tropical forests, coral reefs, mangroves, and more, Cát Bà boasts high biodiversity.

sources.snippet: A World Heritage Site designated as a biosphere reserve, Cat Ba National Park is home to 32 species of mammals, including majority of the 65 remaining golden-headed langur, the most endangered primate in the world. Seventy species of birds and more than a thousand plant species have been documented in the park, including 160 with medicinal value. There are some excellent hiking trails on the island, including an 18-km route that leads to a mountain peak.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

sources.snippet: When it comes to experiencing the breathtaking beauty of Halong Bay, seeking out its top viewpoints is an absolute must. These elevated locations offer a mesmerizing perspective that allows you to immerse yourself in the grandeur of this natural wonder. From island vistas to lofty peaks, each viewpoint offers a unique window into the captivating landscapes that define Halong Bay.
sources.siteName: The ultimate guide to Halong Bay viewpoints for spectacular views
sources.shortName: The ultimate guide to Halong Bay viewpoints for spectacular views

sources.snippet: Cat Ba Island, located in Lan Ha Bay, is the largest island in the region and offers a variety of landscapes to photograph. From rugged cliffs and lush forests to pristine beaches and vibrant markets, Cat Ba Island provides a diverse range of subjects. The viewpoints on the island offer sweeping views of Halong Bay and Lan Ha Bay, ideal for panoramic shots.
sources.shortName: Top Photography Spots in Halong Bay – Luxco Travels

sources.snippet: Located off the coast of Hai Phong City, it has clean beaches (named Cat Co 1 and Cat Co 2) which are ideal for sunbathing and swimming during the summer. And if you are not a fan of crowds, you can go to Monkey Island where the beaches are cleaner and quieter, and you can rent a kayak or charter a speedboat there.
sources.shortName: 29 Best Things to Do in Halong Bay & City: Attractions (Photo)

sources.snippet: Located in Cat Ba island, this point of view encompasses the entire view of Lan Ha Bay, a part of Halong Bay region. Beside the good view to observe from, there are plenty of activities like rock climbing or trekking.
sources.shortName: How to take the best photos in Halong Bay? Expert Advice for Photography in Halong Bay

sources.snippet: Cat Ba Island – The amazing view from the top of the lush Cat Ba Island. It takes a steep hike & several stair steps to get up here, but it’s totally worth it!
sources.shortName: 10 Photos to Inspire You to Visit Halong Bay

sources.snippet: Notably, Lan Ha Bay & Cat Ba Island (Hai Phong province) have earned recognition as a UNESCO World Heritage site, further enhancing their allure.
sources.siteName: Bai Tho Junks Official Site - Halong Bay Boutique Cruises
sources.shortName: Ha Long Bay Travel Guide - A local insight [2024] - Bai Tho Junks

places.name: Cát Bà Island

reviews.text:
The main best attraction is an overnight cruise to Lan ha Bay and Ha Long Bay. Recommend going with Cat Ba Ventures. You may also want to spend an overnight here before the cruise or afterwards. (downside is that there is a lot of trash and debris in the water which is disturbing as a “westerner”. There appears to be no effort by the government to require the local operators of the day cruises or the local fisherman to keep the water clean. Vietnam should follow the example of the Philippines in Palawan, where the beautiful waters are treasured, and the scuba diving and snorkeling is phenomenal.)
We stayed at the Moon Boutique which is affiliated with Cat Ba Ventures. It's very cute hotel and reasonably priced with a very good breakfast. Cat Ba Ventures will also arrange for your transportation from Hanoi or Ninh Binh/Tam Coc . However, if your budget is a bit higher, consider staying at the 5 star   Perle d'Oriente hotel, which is adjacent to Cat Co 3 beach with a lovely pool, a nice beach, a full pool side bar. Just a note, there is a lot of construction going on by Son world of a huge hotel complex with a man-made beach and yacht Harbour, which commenced in late 2024, and as I understand, it is scheduled to be a five-year project. But if you take the cruise boats, you will not see or be bothered by the construction.(Moon Boutique does look out on the construction. The five star hotel, Perle does not. )

Construction going on atm until 2030 at the front but if you take scooter you see beautiful beaches and coast - it's just one part of the island when there's so many other wonderful treasures that the island offers

Lots of construction on main beach - no access to beach and a sky full of cranes….id give this place a miss till they finish the work over the next 5 years. We stayed long enough to do a bay day tour (excellent) but the vibe on the main drag sort of ruined it we left a day early

places.address: Trân Châu, Cát Hải, Hai Phong, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: When visiting Ha Long Bay, don't miss the breathtaking Sun Wheel, a towering Ferris wheel perched atop Ba Deo mountain. With 64 cabins and a capacity of 1,200 passengers per hour, it offers unrivaled panoramic views of the World Heritage site below. Take the cable car to reach this attraction and be greeted by stunning vistas both day and night.

sources.snippet: Unrivaled panoramic view of Ha Long Bay – World Heritage site from Sun Wheel. Located atop of Ba Deo mountain at nearly 250m above the sea-level, Sun Wheel places among the top world’s tallest sightseeing Ferris wheels. Sun Wheel Ha Long, featuring a total of 64 cabins with 384 passengers and a capacity of 1.200 passengers/hour, promises to provide visitors with a brand new outlook while gazing down the breath-taking panoramic landscape of Ha Long Bay.
sources.shortName: How to take the best photos in Halong Bay? Expert Advice for Photography in Halong Bay

sources.snippet: The Queen Cable Car connects Bai Chay and Ba Deo Hill with the world’s tallest cable post reaches nearly 190 meters in height. This is why a cable car trip makes it in the top places to admire Halong Bay in its best.
sources.shortName: Best Photogenic Spots in Halong Bay

places.name: Sun Wheel

reviews.text:
Free to go on once you've paid for admission to the rest of the park (includes the cable car). Great view from the top.
They can stop the wheel if you need extra time to get on or off.

Sun World's Sun Wheel in Ha Long is an impressive landmark that dominates the skyline and can be seen from miles away. I was really looking forward to experiencing the view from the top, but unfortunately, the Sun Wheel was closed during our visit.

Despite this, the trip was worthwhile. To reach the Sun Wheel, we took a scenic cable car ride, which was an adventure in itself and offered stunning views of Ha Long Bay. The ticket price was 360,000 VND per adult, and I felt it was reasonable considering the overall experience.

Even though the main attraction was unavailable, we enjoyed exploring the beautifully designed Japanese-style buildings in the area. The architecture adds a unique cultural touch to the park. The Dragon Slide was another highlight, providing a fun and thrilling ride that we thoroughly enjoyed.

I hope to return when the Sun Wheel is operational to complete the experience. Overall, it's a great place to visit for families and anyone looking to enjoy a day out in Ha Long.

Free to go on if you pay to go on the tele cart. Was a wonderful experience. The staff were efficient, and we didn't really queue for more than 10 minutes for both the tele cart or Ferris wheel. The views over Ha Long city and Ha long bay are incredible and if like me youre a little un fond of heights its not actually to bad as everything feels very secure and well maintained.

places.address: Yết Kiêu, Trần Hưng Đạo, Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Bai Tu Long Bay is a picturesque destination featuring Bái Tử Long National Park, boat tours, and numerous small islands. It shares similar geographical features with Halong Bay and Lan Ha Bay, such as limestone pillars, karst caves, and turquoise waters. The best way to experience its beauty is through day cruises or overnight junks, exploring tiny islands and towering limestone cliffs while stopping for cave exploration, kayaking, and swimming on pristine beaches.

sources.snippet: As it is located in the far east of Halong Bay, Bai Tu Long Bay sees substantially fewer tourists than the rest of the region’s many attractions. As such, it is perfect for people looking for an off the beaten path experience. This lesser-known alternative to Halong Bay has gorgeous beaches, impressive caves, and secluded villages for you to explore; these offer up a myriad of hiking, snorkeling, and rock climbing opportunities.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to do in Halong Bay, Vietnam

sources.snippet: Located northeast of Halong Bay, Bai Tu Long Bay actually forms three quarters of the more popular World Heritage Site. With hundreds of its own karst island formations, Bai Tu Long Bay easily rivals the scenic beauty of Halong. It is a newer route situated east of the wildly popular cruising loops taken by most boats, far from the plethora of tourists and scores of vessels that sail across Halong.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

sources.snippet: For those seeking a quieter and less crowded photography experience, Bai Tu Long Bay is an excellent choice. This area offers similar stunning landscapes to Halong Bay but with fewer tourists. The serene waters and untouched karsts make for beautiful, peaceful photographs, especially during the early morning or late afternoon.
sources.shortName: Top Photography Spots in Halong Bay – Luxco Travels

sources.snippet: Located in the East of Ha Long Bay, Bai Tu Long Bay is an off-the-beaten-track destination which is outstanding with the beauty of karsts and limestone mountains. In Bai Tu Long Bay, you can kayak in Vung Vieng Fishing Village, snorkel in Ban Chan Beach, relax in Ang Du area, and learn the history of Thien Canh Son cave.
sources.shortName: 29 Best Things to Do in Halong Bay & City: Attractions (Photo)

sources.snippet: Beyond Halong Bay, the adjacent Bai Tu Long Bay and Lan Ha Bay are equally renowned for their captivating beauty. Notably, Lan Ha Bay & Cat Ba Island (Hai Phong province) have earned recognition as a UNESCO World Heritage site, further enhancing their allure.
sources.siteName: Bai Tho Junks Official Site - Halong Bay Boutique Cruises
sources.shortName: Ha Long Bay Travel Guide - A local insight [2024] - Bai Tho Junks

places.name: Bai Tu Long Bay

reviews.text: Serene, peaceful and tranquil. Bai Tu Long Bay is absolutely beautiful and worthwhile venturing out to. There are hundreds of mountains around the bay protecting the waters with some with caves you can trek into. Kayaking around this bay around sunset is unreal.

Further north and east of Halong Bay so fewer day trippers. More secluded yet as beautiful as Halong Bay. Tip: if you can spare the time, a 3 day 2 night boat trip gives you time to appreciate the magnificence of this World Heritage area to the fullest

Bai Tu Long is a beautiful area protected by hundreds of islands. The scenery is tranquil and out of this world. I have never seen anything quite like it. I highly recommend a longer 3-day - 2-night cruise to escape the massive crowds within Halong Bay.

places.generalDescription: Ti Top Island is a small but picturesque island in Halong Bay, known for its crescent-shaped beach at the foot of a mountain. It's a popular stop on many cruise itineraries, offering stunning views from the central vantage point and a tourist-friendly beach below. While it can get crowded due to the influx of tourist boats, arriving early in the morning allows for a less crowded experience and an opportunity to hike up around 400 steps to reach the viewpoint gazebo.

sources.snippet: Named in honor of Russian cosmonaut Gherman Titov who visited Halong Bay in 1962, Titop Island and its surrounding waters offer a stunning sight from afar – an imposing tower of limestone jutting out of the water and shrouded with thick rainforest. It has long been part of the itinerary of many cruises as it is considered as one of the ‘must-see’ attractions in Halong Bay, thanks to the mesmerizing views and the tourist-friendly beach at its base. Titop Island is pretty small, covering a total area of 3.7 hectares.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

sources.snippet: Boasting one of the best views of Halong Bay, Ti Top Island is a very popular place to visit, and lots of cruise ships stop off here while on a tour of the bay. Its lovely crescent beach is perfect for kicking back and relaxing on, while the surrounding waters make for some fantastic swimming and snorkeling. Named after the Russian cosmonaut, Gherman Stephanovic Titov, the small island has plenty of tourist facilities, with deck chairs, a restaurant, and bar all on offer.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to do in Halong Bay, Vietnam

sources.snippet: Located about 14 kilometers from Bai Chay tourist harbor, Ti Top island is famous for a crescent moon shaped beach which has beautiful still blue waters and tranquility. Thanks to the calm waters and immaculate white sands, the beach is perfect for water-based activities like swimming, snorkeling, and kayaking. There is also a bar where you can rent all kinds of swim gear or stop for a drink if you want.
sources.shortName: 29 Best Things to Do in Halong Bay & City: Attractions (Photo)

sources.snippet: When it comes to experiencing the breathtaking beauty of Halong Bay, seeking out its top viewpoints is an absolute must. These elevated locations offer a mesmerizing perspective that allows you to immerse yourself in the grandeur of this natural wonder. From island vistas to lofty peaks, each viewpoint offers a unique window into the captivating landscapes that define Halong Bay.
sources.siteName: The ultimate guide to Halong Bay viewpoints for spectacular views
sources.shortName: The ultimate guide to Halong Bay viewpoints for spectacular views

sources.snippet: Ti Top Island offers one of the best panoramic views of Halong Bay. A short hike to the top of the island rewards you with a 360-degree vista of the bay’s emerald waters and limestone formations. The climb is relatively moderate and the viewpoint at the summit is perfect for sunrise or sunset shots, providing the golden light that adds depth and warmth to your photos.
sources.shortName: Top Photography Spots in Halong Bay – Luxco Travels

sources.snippet: During a day cruise, you can explore renowned attractions in Halong Bay, such as Sung Sot Cave and Titop Island, or engage in activities like kayaking and bamboo boat rides in Luon Cave. Additionally, you have the opportunity to visit floating villages and partake in various activities, with lunch provided on board as part of the day cruise program.
sources.siteName: Bai Tho Junks Official Site - Halong Bay Boutique Cruises
sources.shortName: Ha Long Bay Travel Guide - A local insight [2024] - Bai Tho Junks

sources.snippet: The plan to take epic photos in HaLong Bay would not be complete without a list of beautiful attractions such as Ti Top Island, limestone cave, Sung Sot cave, Trong Mai island. Those are really the castles of the Creator in the middle of the world.
sources.shortName: 7 tips to capture the beautiful scenery of HaLong Bay

sources.snippet: The next big name to lead this chart of where to get the best photos in Halong is Ti Top Mountain. Ti Top is situated right in the middle of the Bay where you can drop by for a visit and some ultimate photo hunting at any time in the year.
sources.shortName: Best Photogenic Spots in Halong Bay

sources.snippet: Ti Top Island: Another perfect view to photograph Halong Bay is Ti Top Island, 8 km from the Southeast of Bai Chay Harbor. Here, you will get a much different perspective from the sandy shore to the high sky in Halong Bay.
sources.shortName: 8 Photography Tips to Take the Best Photos in Halong Bay

sources.snippet: No better place than Ti Top Mountain to experience the beauty of Halong Bay. Right in the heart of Halong Bay lies Ti Top Mountain, 8 kilometers from the Southeast of Bai Chay Harbor.
sources.shortName: Halong Bay: Best places to photograph
10 Photos to Inspire You to Visit Halong Bay

places.name: Ti Top Island

reviews.text: This is a beautiful island that we visited as part of our Ha Long Bay cruise. It has over 400 steps to climb, which can be quite challenging, but once you reach the top you're rewarded with stunning panoramic views of the bay.

A relatively new beach with great views all around. The climb up to the top of the hill was steep, but you get one of the best views up there! The only big issue was the immense crowd around the beach area, from the various cruises. There are just too many tourists around to pick a spot to chill.

Visited in April 2025.

A crowded 400-step staircase leads to the top of Ti Top Island in Ha Long Bay, Vietnam. The beach here attracts large numbers of excursion boat tourists. The view from the summit is excellent. Over development is a concern as the area's popularity has led to increasing numbers of excursion boats coming here.

places.generalDescription: Trung Trang Cave, nestled just 1km south of the Cat Ba National Park center, is a stunning natural wonder that draws in countless visitors each year. This expansive cave system spans approximately 300 meters and showcases an array of captivating stalactite and stalagmite formations that have been sculpted over millennia. As you wander through its intricate chambers, you'll be transported into a world where nature's artistry reigns supreme.

sources.snippet: Stretching for about 300 meters, this is one of the most remarkable caves in Cat Ba Island and certainly one of the top Halong Bay attractions. Venturing inside is like stepping into nature’s wonderland, thanks to the thousands of sparkling stalactites that take on different shapes and forms. Over the years, the cave has been called several names.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

places.name: Trung Trang Cave

reviews.text:
Worth visiting, if nearby.
Look at the photos to get an idea of the images you'd encounter.
Everything is regular in size (140 stairs to reach the entrance, 300m the cave length) so it's the ideal start of the morning for those cruising the area.
In April the right gear to wear is shorts & sneakers.

Taxi dropped me at Trung  Trang cave. Ticket was 120k.
Young guy at ticket office spoke very good English.
He said it takes about 15-20 minutes easy walk.
I walked about 100 metres down path  then right up stairs to cave entrance.
Well lit cave with good path inside.
Narrow in one place, turn sideways to get through.
Also some low areas, where you will be squatting down or on your hands and knees, depending on how good your knees are.
Easy walk.
Nice rock formations inside.
At the end you will see some Bats on the ceiling of the cave chilling out. There's two types of Bats  in the area.
You then walk the exit path. There's a cafe near end of the path near the road.
Beers and drinks for sale.

My taxi driver was waiting for me there and we continued onto the Hospital cave a few minutes away.

Not a big cave, but a good little walk.

You can buy a ticket from the Cat Ba National Park to also include this cave for 120,000 dong.

The cave is amazing. Pure silence inside, the serene sound of water dripping, beautiful cave formations. Just enough light to paint shadows on the textured walls.

Unfortunately I didn't stay long inside enough to fully admire everything :( but would definitely go again!

And apparently you can park your motorcycle for free near the exit (you will exit a different path the entrance).

places.address: Đường xuyên đảo Cát Bà, Trân Châu, Cát Hải, Hải Phòng, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Poem Mountain, also known as Bai Tho Mountain, is a towering limestone outcrop in Ha Long City adorned with 15th-century poetry carvings. It offers panoramic views of the stunning landscape of Ha Long Bay, making it a must-visit for photographers and nature enthusiasts. The mountain is steeped in history and culture, with engravings of poems by emperors and famous figures from the past.

sources.snippet: A 200-metre limestone mountain in the heart of Halong City, Bai Tho Mountain requires a 30-minute hike but will reward you with impressive vistas onto the city and the bays beyond. With half of its foothills roving over the land and the rest immersed in the ocean, the mountain has been compared to a tiger ready to pounce and to a dragon preparing to fly away. According to a legend, in 1468 King Le Thanh Tong was patrolling the northeast coast by boat and was so touched by the charming scenery that he had his own poem carved into the mountain’s cliff face.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

sources.snippet: Some high places for panoramic view for panorama photos are must-visit for photographers including mounts of some mountains that is accessible such as mount Titop, mount Bai Tho (Poem Mount) . From the mounts, you can take a glimpse over the bay and take a photo like a flying cam, covering the range of green mountains, the leisure boats, and the thick vegetations on the mountains. This is the corner where you capture the most magnificent view of Halong Bay from the sky, showing the viewers how adorable and magical the bay is.
sources.shortName: How to take the best photos in Halong Bay? Expert Advice for Photography in Halong Bay

sources.snippet: Poem Mountain ( Bai Tho Mountain) has got its name since 1268 when King Le Thanh Tong carved a poem on a cliff at the mountain. Thanks to the mountain side which overlooks the bay, Poem Mountain is the most ideal viewing spot in Halong Bay. Standing on the mountain and looking down, you will understand why the bay is called Halong.
sources.shortName: 29 Best Things to Do in Halong Bay & City: Attractions (Photo)

places.name: Bài Thơ Mountain

reviews.text:
Bái Thơ Mountain (Núi Bài Thơ) is one of the most famous tourist destinations in Ha Long, Quang Ninh, offering both stunning natural beauty and historical significance. Located in the heart of Ha Long City, the mountain stands as an iconic landmark, attracting visitors with its breathtaking views and cultural heritage.

The mountain, with an elevation of 200 meters, is not particularly high, but it provides a magnificent panoramic view of Ha Long Bay, which is known for its emerald waters and thousands of limestone islands. From the summit, visitors can enjoy a 360-degree view of the bay, the bustling city, and nearby islands, making it an ideal spot for photography and sightseeing. The view from Bái Thơ Mountain is especially mesmerizing at sunset, when the sky is painted with shades of orange and pink, creating a peaceful and scenic atmosphere.

In addition to its natural beauty, Bái Thơ Mountain is also historically significant. At the top of the mountain, there is an ancient stone inscription with the words “Bái Thơ,” which means “poetry offering,” created by King Le Thanh Tong in 1468. The inscription honors the natural beauty of Ha Long Bay and the poetic spirit of the region. It is said that the king visited the mountain to enjoy the view and compose poetry, which further adds to the cultural appeal of the site.

For those visiting Ha Long, climbing Bái Thơ Mountain is a must-do activity. The hike is relatively easy and takes around 20-30 minutes, making it accessible to most visitors. The trail is lined with trees and steps that lead to the top, where the magnificent view awaits. Whether you're a nature lover, a photography enthusiast, or a history buff, Bái Thơ Mountain offers an unforgettable experience.

I seldom leave review but I think it is necessary to provide some useful guidance for those hiking enthusiasts.

A big thanks to Theresa Lou (the last review before me) who had clearly pointed out that the entrance to the mountain is 106 Hang Noi, which is totally different from the information that can be found on the website (which mentions the blue door beside a photocopy shop).

In fact, I have passed by the blue door when taking a grab. If you are taking a grab, you can put the address as 86 Hang Noi. Do note that 106 Hang Noi is not directly facing the main street. So after you alight, look for a lady and say the word ‘mountain'. She will respond to you if she is the right person and she will ask you to walk through the alley and she will meet you at the behind of her house.

You will enter her house and climb the stairs to the third floor which leads to the outside gate. The lady will continue to guide you and you will see a long ladder which you will need to move it together with her and put it against the rock wall. She then asked for money, and I directly gave VND100K and she accepted it.

The most challenging part is to climb the ladder and hike towards the left direction until you see a proper walk path with wooden fence. Then just continue the path until to the top of the mountain. I spent around 20 minutes from climbing the ladder to the summit, which was considerably fast.

Rest assured that the view is totally rewarding and you will be amazed by the scenery!

I went there by grab and the address I used was Hang Noi 86. This viewpoint has different entrances, it can be at house number 86 or house 106 from what I know. I used the house number 86. Most of the trail has a good path made of concrete but no maintenance, I think they made that to reach the internet antenna up on the viewpoint. After entering house number 86 I paid 100.000 and started my walk. The beginning is hard as you can see in the first video. You have to use the ladder and then climb the mountain slightly. This part is dangerous, but after that, it's okay. I recommend you do the trail early in the mourning because there is no shade at all and it was so hot up there

places.address: Hàng Nồi, P, Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Ba Trai Dao, also known as the Three Peaches, is a group of three small islands rising dramatically from the turquoise waters of Halong Bay. Legend has it that these islands were once peaches stolen from heaven by a fairy to grant immortality to a poor fisherman she loved. The King of Heaven turned them into the craggy mounts seen today in his anger. These foliage-covered rocks offer secluded sandy beaches perfect for kayaking and swimming.

sources.snippet: Rising dramatically from the shimmering turquoise waters, the Ba Trai Dao Islets certainly paint a very pretty picture, and their distinctive shape makes them one of the most recognizable sights in Halong Bay. The three small islands are known as the ‘three peaches,’ named after a local legend where a fairy steals some peaches from heaven to give to a poor fisherman who she has fallen in love with; in doing so, she grants him immortality. The King of Heaven found out, however, and in his anger instead turned the peaches into the craggy mounts you see before you today.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things to do in Halong Bay, Vietnam

sources.snippet: The Ba Trai Dao area consists of three small mountains that resemble three peaches when seen from afar. Located in the southeast section of Halong Bay near Cat Ba Island, it is featured with the Ba Trai Dao Beach which takes on the shape of a bow that embraces the islets. The beach is one of the best in the region but tourists can only swim for 2–3 hours a day because the tide rises and submerges the area.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

sources.snippet: Ba Trai Dao beach is also on the tourist track but is unique due to its mythical association. Three small mountains resembling peaches separate the three small beach areas that are ideal for swimming and kayaking around.
sources.shortName: Halong Bay: Best places to photograph

places.name: Ba Trai Dao

reviews.text: Very clear water, suitable for swimming and kayaking. Need to be careful the present of jelly fish.
Great place in Vietnam for kayaking, loved to be here
It's the beach the boat tour from Cat Ba brought me to.

places.generalDescription: Coffee Duyên is a stunning natural grotto located just a few kilometers from Halong City, the starting point for most Halong Bay cruises. This cave, also known as Thien Cung Cave, boasts intricate stalactite and stalagmite formations illuminated by colorful lighting. With its vast interior spanning 3,000 square meters and several levels with impressively high ceilings, it is considered the most beautiful cave in Halong Bay.

sources.snippet: Thien Cung Cave is situated in the south-west section of Halong Bay, approximately 4km from the port of Dau Go Island. It is positively huge, covering an area of 10,000 square meters. The interior is complex so an expert guide will certainly come in handy.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Tourist Attractions of the Halong Bay Area

places.name: Động Thiên Cung

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Thien Cung Cave

(Original)
Động Thiên Cung
You can experience art created by nature.

(Translated by Google) This is the most popular limestone cave in Halong Bay.
It means "Heavenly Palace" in Vietnamese.
It is a beautiful cave that lives up to its name.
If you book a Halong Bay cruise, you will likely have many opportunities to visit this cave.

(Original)
ハロン湾で最もポピュラーな鍾乳洞です。
ベトナム語で「天宮」という意味です。
その名にふさわしい美しい鍾乳洞です。
ハロン湾クルーズに申し込めばここを訪問する機会も多いのではないかと思います。
reviews.author_name: トレーズクシュリナーダ

places.generalDescription: Hòn Trống Mái, also known as Hòn Gà Chọi or Fighting Cocks Island, is a remarkable pair of islets in Halong Bay. The 12-meter rock formations create a stunning sight over the water and are popular among photographers, especially during sunrise and sunset. Another unique attraction is the cave within the island, which produces drumming-like echoes when the wind passes through its stalactites and stalagmites.

sources.snippet: The plan to take epic photos in HaLong Bay would not be complete without a list of beautiful attractions such as Ti Top Island, limestone cave, Sung Sot cave, Trong Mai island. Those are really the castles of the Creator in the middle of the world.
sources.shortName: 7 tips to capture the beautiful scenery of HaLong Bay

sources.snippet: Trong Mai Islet: The most iconic image of Halong Bay is probably the most photographed scene among foreign tourists. The two chicken kissing rock formations has become a favorite spot that attracts many couples in Halong Bay to photograph.
sources.shortName: 8 Photography Tips to Take the Best Photos in Halong Bay
Halong Bay: Best places to photograph

places.name: Hòn Trống Mái Hạ Long

reviews.text:
Beautiful but so so touristy. Had to squeeze around with a lot of people at all the various stops. Nevertheless, scenery from the boat was pretty spectacular (with the occasional interruptions from other big boats).

Personally I prefer my visit to Ninh Binh over Ha Long Bay.

Very interesting duo islands that if you see it from the north side, they look like kissing islands.   As you get closer and from the south side, it just look like 2 islands very close together.   Very beautiful scene.

A nice bay surrounded by many mountains, islands, and islets that rise out of the water. It's also a UNESCO world heritage site located in the northern part of Vietnam. Although water wasn't as clear as expected, it was worth VISITING!

places.address: V2RG+6F4, Hòn Trống Mái, Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh

places.generalDescription: Halong Bay is a stunning destination with scattered floating villages such as Cua Van, Ba Hang, Cong Dam, Hoa Cuong, Van Boi or Vung Vieng. These villages offer a glimpse into the unique lifestyle of local fishermen who live in floating houses and rely on boats for their daily activities. Visitors can meet friendly locals and playful kids while experiencing the charm of these fishing communities.

sources.snippet: Halong Bay is known as one of the most beautiful places in the world, but there's something extra special about its sunrise. As the sun comes up over the calm...
sources.siteName: Stunning Halong Bay Images to Inspire Your Next Trip
sources.shortName: Stunning Halong Bay Images to Inspire Your Next Trip
The Images Of Halong Bay Tourist Sites

places.name: Halong Bay

reviews.text: We did this as part of a day tour from Hanoi, the bay is beautiful, we are so glad we visited this UNESCO heritage site - we saw lots of references to rubbish, which was really off putting , but would like to say that we only saw one plastic bottle , so don't let this out you off . We also got to swim in the bay - how many times in your life will you get that experience. Will have a look and see who we booked with and review this company as it was a great all-round day .

Halong bay is a world class place I must say.
It's one of the best rigions I have travelled in my life.
The ocean is very unique with lots of towering limestone islands 🏝️. It's obviously rare in the world.
Besides the sunwheel 🎡 , the cable 🚡 car and the bridge 🌉 that connects two lands sides are amazing to see.
All this things can be seen together from the sea beach.
You can see very good city view from the cable car.

In one word Halong bay is just "Top-notch" 🔥 🔥 🔥.

A place to remember from far...💙
Beautiful place to visit, must see area if visiting Vietnam

places.address: X27X+Q63, Bãi Cháy, Hạ Long, Quảng Ninh, Vietnam
